title: The Immigrants And the Suburbs
body:
To the Editor:

     "A Suburb All Grown Up and Paved Over," by David Plotz (Op-Ed, June 19), maintains that Fairfax County, Va., 
"is the very model of the benefits of immigration." 

 The benefits he describes: up to six cars parked on paved-over yards; climbing poverty rates; "sprawled suburbs," 
packed houses of "sisters, husbands and cousins," and a lost rural character. If those are the benefits of 
immigration, what are the disadvantages?

LINDA H. THOM

Coupeville, Wash., June 20, 2002

http://www.nytimes.com
